name: UpdateWorkflowById
description:
Update a specific workflow by its ID.

Use this tool to update the details of a workflow in Datadog by providing its ID. Ensure required permissions via a registered application key or configure them in the UI.

parameters.name: workflow_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the workflow you wish to update in Datadog.

parameters.name: workflow_update_data
parameters.description: The JSON data for updating the workflow, including its attributes, specifications, and relationships.

published.description: Set the workflow to published or unpublished. Workflows in an unpublished state will only be executable via manual runs. Automatic triggers such as Schedule will not execute the workflow until it is published.

annotations.description: A list of annotations used in the workflow. These are like sticky notes for your workflow!

connectionEnvs.description: A list of connections or connection groups used in the workflow.

handle.description: Unique identifier used to trigger workflows automatically in Datadog.

inputSchema.description: A list of input parameters for the workflow. These can be used as dynamic runtime values in your workflow.

outputSchema.description: A list of output parameters for the workflow.

actionId.description: The unique identifier of an action.

interval.description: The `RetryStrategyLinear` `interval`. The expected format is the number of seconds ending with an s. For example, 1 day is 86400s

completionGate.description: Used to create conditions before running subsequent actions.

connectionLabel.description: The unique identifier of a connection defined in the spec.

interval.description: The `RetryStrategyLinear` `interval`. The expected format is the number of seconds ending with an s. For example, 1 day is 86400s

outboundEdges.description: A list of subsequent actions to run.

parameters.description: A list of inputs for an action.

readinessGate.description: Used to merge multiple branches into a single branch.

steps.description: A `Step` is a sub-component of a workflow. Each `Step` performs an action.

triggers.description: The list of triggers that activate this workflow. At least one trigger is required, and each trigger type may appear at most once.

spec.description: The spec defines what the workflow does.

updatedAt.description: When the workflow was last updated.

webhookSecret.description: If a Webhook trigger is defined on this workflow, a webhookSecret is required and should be provided here.

data.description: Data related to the workflow being updated.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
